diff.a: Code:â€ƒCFR To cite the regulations in thi
olume use title, part and section number. Thus, 22 CFR 1.1 refers to title 22, part 1, section 1. Explanation The Code of Federal Reg
lations is a codification of the general and permanent rules published in the Federa
rtments and agencies of the Federal Governme
t. The Code is divided into 50 titles which represent broad areas subject to Federal regulat
. Each title is divided into chapters which usually bear the name of the issuing agency.
o parts covering specific regulatory areas. Each volu
e of the Code is revised at least once ea
h calendar year and issued on a quarterly basis approximately as follows: Title 1 through Title 16 as of January 1 Title 17 through Title
7 as of April 1 Title 28 through Title 41 as of July 1 Title
Title 50 as of October 1 The appropriate revision date is printed on the cover of each vo

udicially noticed (44 U.S.C. 1507). The Code of Federal Regulations is prima facie evidence of the text of the original documents (44 U.S.C. 1510). HOW TO USE THE CODE OF FEDERAL REGULATIONS The Code of Federal Regulations is kept up to date by the indiv
dual issues of the Federal Register. These two publications must be used together to determine the latest version of any given rule. To determine wh
ther a Code volume has been
his case, April 1, 2019), consult the â€œList of CFR Sections Affected (LSA),â€ whic
is issued monthly, and the â€œCumulative List of Parts Affected,â€ which appears in the Reader Aids section of the daily Federal Register. These t
o lists will identify the Federa
the latest amendment of any given rule. EFFECTIVE AND EXPIRA
ns amendments published in the Federal Regis
er since the last revision of tha
volume of the Code. Source citations for the
ber of the Federal Register and date of publication. Publication dates and effective dates are usually not the same and care must be exe
by the user in determining the actual effective date. In instances w
e the effective date is beyond the cut-off date for the Code a note has be
n inserted to reflect the future effective date. In those instances where a reg
egister states a date certain for expiration, an appropriate note will be inserted following the text. OM
CONTROL NUMBERS The Paperwork Reduction Act of 1980 (Pub. L. 96-511) re
cies to display an OMB control number with their informat
on collection request. Many agencies have
egun publishing numerous OMB control numbers as amendments to existing regulations in the CFR. These OMB numbers are placed as close as possibl
irements. PAST PROVISIONS OF THE CODE Provisions of the Code that are no longer in force and effect as of the revision date stated on the co
olume are not carried. Code users may find the text of provisions in eff
ct on any given date in the p
st by using the appropriate List of CFR Sections Affected (LSA). For
e of the reader, a â€œList of CFR Sections Affectedâ€ is published at the end of
olume. For changes to the Code p
ior to the LSA listings at the end of the volume, consult previous annual editions of the LSA. For changes to the Code prior to 2001, consult the List of CFR Sections A

cy may add regulatory information at a â€œ[Reserved]â€ location at any time. Occasionally â€œ[Reserved]â€ is used editorially to indicate t
f the CFR was left vacant and not accidentally dropped due to a
rinting or computer error. INCORPORATION BY REFERENCE What is incorporation by reference? Incorporation by r
ference was established by statute and allows Federal agencies to meet the requirement to publish regulations in the Federal Register by referring
tion to be valid, the Director o
must approve it. The legal effect of incorporation by reference is that the material is treated as
if it were published in full in the Federal Register (5 U.S.C. 552(a)). This material, like a
y other properly issued regulation, h
s the force of law. What is a proper incorporat
tor of the Federal Register will approve an incorporation by reference only when the requirements of 1 CFR part 51 are met. Some of the elements on
hich approval is based are: (a) The incorporation will substantially reduce the volume of material pub
Register. (b) The matter incorporated is in fac

available to the extent necessary to afford fairness and uniformity in the administrative process. (c) The incorporating document is drafted and submitted for publication in accordance with 1 CFR part
1. What if the material incorporated by reference cannot be found? If you have any problem locating or obtaining a copy of material listed as an approved
n by reference, please contact the agency that issued the regulation containing that
incorporation. If, after contacting the agency, you find the material is not available, please notif
the Director of the Federal Register, National Archives and
ecords Administration, 8601 Adelphi Road, College Park, MD 20740-6001, or call 202-741-6010. CFR INDEXES AND

in the daily Federal Register. A List of CFR Sections Affected (LSA) is published mo
thly, keyed to the revision dates of the 50 CFR titles. REPUBLICATION OF MATERIAL There are no restrictions on
ial appearing in the Code of
